DOCNAME: CASE OF KILIÇGEDİK AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Guido Raimondi;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . PERSON ( ORG , hereafter referred to as “ HADEP ” ) was a political party which was established on DATE . It opened branches in CARDINAL cities and in CARDINAL of districts . The applicants were members of ORG and they held executive positions within the party .

CARDINAL . On DATE the chief prosecutor at ORG brought proceedings before ORG and demanded that HADEP be dissolved . The prosecutor argued that ORG had become a “ centre of illegal activities against the integrity of GPE ” . In support of his allegations he referred to a number of pending criminal proceedings against HADEP members , including the applicants .

CARDINAL . In its decision of CARDINAL DATE , which was published in ORG on DATE and thus became final , ORG dissolved HADEP . The ORG based its decision on sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the LAW and sections FAC and CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL on Political Parties . In arriving at its conclusion , ORG took account of the actions and statements of certain leaders and members of ORG , including the applicants . As an ancillary measure under LAW § CARDINAL of the LAW and section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL , ORG banned the applicants and CARDINAL other HADEP members and leaders from becoming founder members , ordinary members , leaders or auditors of any other political party for DATE .

CARDINAL . Details of the criminal proceedings which had been brought against the applicants and which were referred to by ORG in its decision are detailed below . In the opinion of ORG , the actions of the applicants which are set out below , as well as the actions of the remaining CARDINAL HADEP members and leaders , proved that a link existed between the applicants , HADEP and the ORG .

CARDINAL . These applicants were executive members of ORG 's ORG branch . In DATE criminal proceedings were brought against them for lending assistance to an illegal organisation , namely the ORG , contrary to LAW then in force . The allegations against them included allowing hunger strikers to use HADEP premises in their protest against the arrest of PERSON in GPE . Banners had also been displayed on ORG 's premises expressing discomfort with the arrest , as well as denigrating the NORP state and actions of the NORP security forces . People present on the premises had also been allowed to watch ORG propaganda broadcasts on ORG . Various pro - ORG newspapers and journals , as well as photographs of various ORG members who had been killed in operations , were also recovered from the LOC .
CARDINAL . These applicants were subsequently tried by ORG and were found guilty on DATE . They were sentenced to DATE and DATE imprisonment and their conviction was upheld by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The execution of the applicants ' prison sentences was suspended following the entry into force of Law no . DATE on Conditional Release , Stay of Proceedings and Suspension of Punishment .

CARDINAL . These applicants were executive members of ORG 's PERSON branch . In DATE criminal proceedings were brought against them for lending assistance to the ORG , contrary to LAW then in force . The allegations against them included allowing hunger strikers to use HADEP premises in their protest against the arrest of PERSON in GPE and keeping a NORP flag on the same LOC .
CARDINAL . These applicants were subsequently tried by ORG and were found guilty on DATE . They were sentenced to DATE and DATE imprisonment and their conviction was upheld by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The execution of the applicants ' prison sentences was suspended following the entry into force of PERSON no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found Mr Bülbül guilty of lending assistance to the ORG , contrary to LAW then in force , in a speech he had made at a HADEP congress . He was sentenced to DATE and DATE imprisonment . While the proceedings were pending before ORG , PERSON no . DATE entered into force . ORG accordingly suspended the criminal proceedings against him on DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE another set of criminal proceedings was brought against the applicant on account of a document entitled “ The NORP who Suffered Historical Injustices , the NORP Problem and Recommendations for its Solution ” , which had been found in his house . The proceedings were suspended following the entry into force of Law no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . Mr LOC was chairman of the GPE branch of ORG until DATE . On DATE ORG found him guilty of lending assistance to the ORG , contrary to LAW then in force , in a speech he had made at a HADEP congress in DATE . He was sentenced to DATE and DATE imprisonment . While they were pending against him the proceedings were suspended following the entry into force of Law no . DATE .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON was a member of the HADEP party council . A number of documents and books prepared by ORG members having been found in his law firm , on DATE ORG found him guilty of lending assistance to the ORG , contrary to LAW then in force , and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment . The proceedings were suspended before ORG following the entry into force of Law no . DATE .

CARDINAL . Mr GPE was the chairman of the GPE branch of ORG . On DATE ORG convicted him of “ incitement to hatred and hostility by making a distinction based on race and regional identity ” , in breach of LAW in force at the material time .

CARDINAL . Mr Ateş was the chairman of the youth commission of ORG . On DATE the ORG found him guilty on CARDINAL counts of spreading separatist propaganda , in breach of section CARDINAL of the Prevention of Terrorism Act , in CARDINAL speeches he had given DATE . In his speeches the applicant had advocated recognition of the NORP identity , and argued that the NORP in GPE were being suppressed by those ruling the country . He had also stated that the ceasefire declared by PERSON had raised the peoples ' hopes . He was sentenced to DATE and DATE imprisonment and his conviction was upheld by ORG on DATE . While the applicant was serving his prison sentence , Law no . DATE entered into force and the execution of the remainder of his sentence was suspended . On DATE section CARDINAL of the Prevention of Terrorism Act was repealed .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON was the chairman of the youth council of ORG in ORG . On DATE the ORG convicted him of lending assistance to the ORG , contrary to LAW then in force , and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment . The court found that the applicant had committed this offence by having organised seminars for university students , during which he had claimed that there were NORP people in GPE who were experiencing a number of problems .
CARDINAL . His conviction was upheld by ORG on DATE but the execution of the sentence was suspended following the entry into force of Law no . DATE .

CARDINAL . Mr Atalay was the secretary of the GPE branch of ORG . On DATE the ORG convicted him of incitement to hatred and hostility , contrary to LAW in force at the time . He was sentenced to DATE imprisonment . His conviction was based on a speech which he had made during a party congress . According to ORG , during his speech Mr Atalay had said things such as that the NORP and NORP were different people , that GPE was at war with the NORP people and that the NORP who were killed during that war were martyrs .

CARDINAL . Mr NORP was the deputy leader of HADEP . On DATE he was found guilty by ORG of spreading separatist propaganda , contrary to LAW then in force . According to ORG , in an article he had written in DATE the applicant had argued that the NORP and NORP were CARDINAL different nations and that the fight the NORP armed forces had been waging against the ORG was a “ dirty war and murder ” . He was sentenced to DATE imprisonment and his conviction was subsequently upheld by ORG . On DATE execution of the applicant 's prison sentence was suspended in accordance with Law no . DATE concerning the suspension of pending cases and penalties in media - related offences .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON made a speech during PERSON celebrations in his capacity as chairman of the LOC branch of ORG . In his speech the applicant stated the following :

“ We , the NORP people , should join forces with the revolutionaries , workers and patriots ... The NORP like the colour red ; because red is the colour of the blood they have been shedding for DATE for their freedom . The NORP like the colour green ; because it is the colour of getting ready for liberation . The NORP like the colour yellow ; because it is the colour of getting ready for everything ” .

CARDINAL . Criminal proceedings were brought against him for spreading separatist propaganda in breach of section CARDINAL of the Prevention of Terrorism Act . On DATE he was found guilty as charged and sentenced to DATE imprisonment . He was also ordered to pay a fine . His conviction was upheld by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE Law no . CARDINAL entered into force and the execution of the judgment against the applicant was suspended . On DATE section CARDINAL of the Prevention of Terrorism Act was repealed .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW in force at the relevant time provided as follows :

“ Any person who , knowing that such an armed gang or organisation is illegal , assists it , harbours its members , provides it with food , weapons and ammunition or clothes or facilitates its operations in any manner whatsoever , shall be sentenced to not CARDINAL and not DATE imprisonment ... ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Criminal Code in force at the relevant time provided as follows :
“ Non - public incitement to commit an offence

A person who expressly praises or condones an act punishable by law as an offence or incites the population to break the law shall , on conviction , be liable to DATE imprisonment and a heavy fine of DATE MONEY .

A person who incites people to hatred or hostility on the basis of a distinction between social classes , races , religions , denominations or regions , shall , on conviction , be liable to CARDINAL imprisonment and a fine of DATE . If this incitement endangers public safety , the sentence shall be increased by CARDINAL to CARDINAL .
The penalties to be imposed on those who have committed the offences defined in the previous paragraph shall be doubled when they have done so by the means listed in LAW . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Prevention of Terrorism Act provided , in so far as relevant , as follows :

“ Written and spoken propaganda , meetings , assemblies and demonstrations aimed at undermining the territorial integrity of GPE or the indivisible unity of the nation are prohibited . Any person who engages in such an activity shall be sentenced to not CARDINAL and not DATE imprisonment and a fine of CARDINAL . The penalty imposed on a reoffender may not be commuted to a fine . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW provides as follows :

“ Founding members or ordinary members whose actions or declarations lead to the permanent dissolution of a political party shall be disqualified from acting as founders , ordinary members , administrators or financial controllers of another political party for DATE starting from the date of publication in ORG of the reasoned decision of ORG . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL on Political Parties provides as follows :

“ Founding members or ordinary members whose actions or declarations lead to the dissolution of a political party shall be disqualified from acting as founders , ordinary members , administrators or financial controllers of another political party for DATE starting from the date of publication in ORG of the reasoned decision of ORG ... ”

CARDINAL . Under PERSON no . DATE , execution of sentences in respect of offences committed before DATE could be suspended if no crime of the same or a more serious kind was committed by the offender within a DATE period .
